comment: Attendance is mandatory. It is a big part of your grade + everything he goes over in class is whats on the tests which he creates. The tests can be challenging but Attendance is worth a big part of your grade so it can help your grade if you dont do well on the tests. His lectures can be boring at times but he gives good real life examples.

Single was good at teaching the material. A little snarky sometimes but it was usually in good humor. If you can't take a jab every now and then, just wait til you meet corporate America. Kidding aside, Single really knew his stuff and related real-world applications in the classroom. Attendance is mandatory and you will need to take notes.

Very lecture heavy. Even if something is briefly mentioned in class, you can assume it will be on the exam. Not the worst professor I have had but he honestly speaks to students in a degrading/harsh way which was very discouraging. Take someone else if you can.

You will not pass if you do not pay attention in class, or do not take notes. Homeworks can be challenging. Professor Single cares about his students, and wants them to understand the material. Cheating in this class is impossible

Single is the most knowledgeable professor I have ever had. Brilliant guy, you can learn a lot, not just stuff for a test. SHOW UP TO CLASS. Tests are open note, but must attend class to get those notes as they are not posted online. Tests come pretty much directly from notes. I wish he taught more courses, I would take him again.
I wish he was clearer with his expectations and went deeper with the material.

I normally hate participating and paying attention to lectures like that but he made class interesting. He broke things down and related it to a lot of real world stuff. Attendance is a grade, so don't take the early class. Lots of HW and quizzes to even the grades out. Tests come straight from what he says, never was surprised. Solid choice

All of his text come specifically from his class lectures! The lectures are actually really good and he makes them very interesting and fun. There are 5 test all weighted the same(50%) then McGraw hill chp. Quizzes(10%) which are super easy and HW(20%) also easy then a Group project kind of as the final(20%). If you take notes and listen your fine!

His tests are based off of what he says in class and he talks really fast. Not the most giving professor in the season of COVID and online semesters. Not the worst, but you have to work extra hard just to receive a B in the course. No curving of exams or dropping any quiz grades. All grades count at the end of the semester so don't have hope.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Do not take him if you are looking for an easy management class for your business degree. He is a hard grader because he grades your work by comparing it to your classmates. Worst thing ever. He does not upload powerpoints and most of exams are what he says in class. Skipping won't help you. Just take someone else because he is just not that good.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He's a nice person overall. Very good at communicating through email during pandemic. Lectures are informative but tests are not similar to lectures. Unless you have all the time in the world to focus on only one class, this is the right professor for you. But if not, then don't take him! Leaves you on your own for the exams every 2 weeks.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Good percentage of your grade is attendance and participation so make sure to go. Lectures aren't posted online so make sure to take good notes. There's a test over every 2 chapter; the first test is in class, the rest are take home. Also gives extra credit and the chance to drop certain grades.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: He grades upon attendance, go to class, a lot of what he goes over in letucre is on the test. Has a test after ever two chapters. He drops the lowest test grade. His test are tough yet he is a lenient grader. There is a group project. He gives great real life examples about the topics. He is very knowledgeable about operation management.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Single is an amazing professor, I believe this is his first year teaching. He was definitely in his introductory stages of getting used to KSU. He has very good knowledge about operation management and applies it in real world settings in every lecture. He has 7 tests that are 50% of your grade and drops one. He gives lots of extra credit

Awesome professor! Talks about real world events in business and makes the class exciting. A lot of tests, but he only includes 1 chapter or 2 per test so its not so much information. He knows the information is tough so he is a lenient grader. Very knowledgeable and definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--TEST HEAVY
